name: electrode production, negative, Ni | electrode, negative, Ni | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3507/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of  of the negative Ni electrode materiall for NiMH batteries production. Main data are taken from an environmental report of a battery producer as well as from literature. In addition own measurements of sizes and weights of batteries were used. It is based on a determined density of 8908 kg/m3 for Ni the total mass of Ni per kg NiMH rechargable battery package of 0.3589 kg Ni electrode. The relevant amount of infrastructure is determined adopting the information from the MAXELL (2003) environmental report in a similar manner like for the positive LaNi5 electrode. This calculation is performed as follows:;<- Single price of NiMH  rechargable battery:	91.89 £ = 224.44 CHF;<- Conversion of consolidated net sales:	65'532'000'000 ¥ = 727'405'200 CHF;<- NiMH revenue fraction: 	727'405'200 CHF * (1/3) * 0.4 = 96’987’360 CHF;<- Annual NiMH battery package production:  	;	96’987’360 CHF / 224.44 CHF = 432’130 NiMH battery package/year;<- Annual Ni electrode production: ;	432’130 Ni electrode /year * 0.3589 kg Ni = 155’113 kg Ni / kg NiMH battery package;<- Infrastructure demand per kg Ni electrode:;	1 plant/ (155’113 kg Ni electrode /year * 50 years) = 1.2894e-7 plants/kg Ni;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This dataset includes (Raw) materials, transport efforts, energy consumption and waste disposal for the production of the negative electrode of NiMH batteries. No emissions to air or water are taken into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module relates to the global situation (electricity consumption according to the main producing countries).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Construction details for NiMH-rechargable batteries and manufacturing conditions documented in the environmental report were adopted.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
The battery package consists of only one large sized battery cell. Technologically a battery cell consists of a multilayered assembly of coats sandwiched to each other and wound eiter circular or prismatically around a virtual axis. The size of this wound layer assembly is specified based on approximations for single cell layer assembly as contained in a LiIo rechargable battery.
The mass of the entire multilayer cell assembly of the considered reference NiMH rechargable battery package is approximated based upon size approximations for the above noted LiIo battery model and is made as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (LiIo rechargable battery): 100.00 mm
Cell layer assembly width (LiIo rechargable battery):	60.00 mm
Battery length (LiIo rechargable battery):	128.00 mm
Battery width (LiIo rechargable battery):	77.00 mm
Battery length (NiMH rechargable battery): 138.00 mm
The calculation is then performed as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (NiMH rechargable battery):
100.00 mm / 128.00 mm = 78.125%
138.00 mm *0.781 = 107.81 mm
 Cell layer assembly width (NiMH rechargable battery):
60.00 mm / 77.00 mm = 77.922%
105.00 mm *0.779 = 81.81 mm 
The thickness (i.e. the depth) of the single unwound layer compartments is approximated with 0.15 mm. Accordingly the single layers are dimensioned as follows (W x D x H): 81.81 mm x 0.15 mm x 107.81 mm.
A multilayer package consists of 5 individual layers, namely positive and negative electrode, separator and electrolyte layer. The thickness of the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly is approximated to 13.5 mm. Adopting the above defined thickness for a single layer (0.15 mm), the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly consists in total of 90 individual layers and 18 windings (with each time 5 individual layers).
